intro: Otostegia erlangeri, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its milky sap is a distinguishing feature, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Otostegia erlangeri is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
